content: The `ArrayList` class is part of the `java.util` package.
name: ArrayList

methods.name: ArrayList
methods.content: The `ArrayList` constructor allows you to create a new `ArrayList` object.

methods.name: add
methods.content: The `add()` method is used to add a specific element to the list.

methods.name: add
methods.content: The `add()` method is used to add an element at a specified index to the list.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"element","type":"E","required":true,"description":"the object to add to the `ArrayList`"},{"name":"index","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the position at which to insert the specified element"}]

methods.name: get
methods.content: The `get()` method is used to retrieve the element at a specified position in an `ArrayList`.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"index","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the index of the element to be returned"}]

methods.name: remove
methods.content: The `remove()` method allows you to remove a specific element from an `ArrayList`.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"index","type":"int","required":true,"description":"index of the element to be removed"}]

methods.name: size
methods.content: The `size()` method returns the number of elements in an `ArrayList`.
